abstract: You can quickly save an error message — and save yourself the trouble of trying to remember what it said when talking to a technical support person.
snippet: You can quickly save an error message — and save yourself the trouble of trying to remember what it said when talking to a technical support person.
lead_paragraph: If you find yourself facing a Windows alert box with far too much arcane error-message information to write down, you can quickly save the message  and save yourself the trouble of trying to remember what it said when talking to a technical support person. Click on the alert box to select it and press Control-C to copy the contents of the error message. Next, open a working word-processing program or e-mail message and press Control-V to paste and save the information.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Saving Error Messages

abstract: I’m still using Outlook 2003, which only allows me to add holidays to my calendar through 2007. Is there a way to get updated holiday information for the program?
snippet: I’m still using Outlook 2003, which only allows me to add holidays to my calendar through 2007. Is there a way to get updated holiday information for the program?
lead_paragraph: Q. I’m still using Outlook 2003, which only allows me to add holidays to my calendar through 2007. Is there a way to get updated holiday information for the program?

abstract: Internet search giant Yahoo, the subject of a hostile takeover bid from Microsoft, led a $20 million investment in Vlingo, a speech recognition start-up.
lead_paragraph: Internet search giant Yahoo, the subject of a hostile takeover bid from Microsoft, led a $20 million investment in Vlingo, a speech recognition start-up.

headline.main: Yahoo Leads $20 Million Round for Vlingo

abstract: Google announced Wednesday that it plans to sell a unit of DoubleClick, the advertising technology company that it acquired recently. The unit, Performics Search Marketing, helps marketers place ads on search engines, including those owned by Google and its main rivals, Yahoo and Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Google announced Wednesday that it plans to sell a unit of DoubleClick, the advertising technology company that it acquired recently. The unit, Performics Search Marketing, helps marketers place ads on search engines, including those owned by Google and its main rivals, Yahoo and Microsoft.

headline.main: After DoubleClick Deal, Google to Cut Jobs and Sell Unit

abstract: A system that can make it easier to put two-dimensional photos into the three-dimensional space of Google Earth is an intriguing alternative to an automated service developed in part by Microsoft.
snippet: A system that can make it easier to put two-dimensional photos into the three-dimensional space of Google Earth is an intriguing alternative to an automated service developed in part by Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: The tension between computing technology that augments human activity and technology that automates it goes all the way back to the 1960s.

headline.main: A 3-D Viewfinder for a Shoebox of Digital Photos
